name: ArrowCreek Country Club
description: The Club at ArrowCreek boasts two exceptional championship golf courses— The Legend Course and The Challenge Course —each offering a unique test of skill against the stunning backdrop of the Sierra Nevada mountains. Designed by golf legends Arnold Palmer and Fuzzy Zoeller, these courses feature dramatic elevation changes, strategically placed bunkers, and fast, undulating greens that demand precision and strategy. The immaculate course conditions, combined with breathtaking panoramic views and a private, exclusive atmosphere, make ArrowCreek a premier destination for golfers seeking both challenge and beauty during their round.

facilities: Expansive Practice Range – A grass driving range with multiple target greens to fine-tune long and mid-range shots.
Short Game Practice Area – Dedicated spaces for chipping, pitching, and bunker play , allowing you to sharpen their short-game skills.
Large Putting Green – A spacious putting surface designed to mimic on-course conditions, ideal for perfecting putting strokes.
Fully Stocked Golf Shop – A pro shop featuring the latest in golf apparel, equipment, and accessories from top brands.

Great Clubhouse – Multiple restaurants are accessible to non-members during their day’s play, and beautiful lockers rooms offer amenities not found at many Reno golf courses that the public can access.

pointOfView: Both the courses at The Club at Arrowcreek are great, but we like to play The Challenge Course a little bit more. It's routed at a slightly higher elevation than the Legend Course, making the views absolutely spectacular! The Challenge Course plays more in front of you, whereas a number of blind landing areas on the Legend Course can make shot lines unclear and daunting, especially off of the tee.
contentParagraphs: Play ArrowCreek in Reno with golf groups, tee times, and stay and play packages. Expert trip planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure groups.

While playing the Challenge Course at The Club at ArrowCreek, breathtaking panoramic views of the Sierra Nevada mountains, the sprawling Reno skyline, and the stunning desert landscapes offer a mesmerizing backdrop to the round. It is truly a spectacular panorama that is difficult to beat.

Although private, Golf the High Sierra customers can gain access to the golf courses and club facilities on their day of play. The staff treat every golfer as a member, and many of the club amenities are available to non-members throughout their visit.
Some of the best sushi the Reno has to offer is available at Tony’s. Make sure to plan enough time to enjoy delicious rolls, fresh nigiri, and other unique creations during your day.
Don’t be late for your tee time! Get there early and spend time practicing on their massive and beautiful practice facility.

featuredHole.title: Legend Course — Hole #17
featuredHole.description: Arnold Palmer designed this dramatic par 3 with a 200-foot elevation drop from tee to green. The Sierra Nevada panorama behind the pin is one of the best views in Reno golf. Play one less club than you think — the ball flies far at elevation.

testimonials.quote: Booked ArrowCreek Country Club as part of a 3-course package with Golf the High Sierra. This was the standout round. Great elevation changes, strategic bunkering, and the staff couldn't have been more welcoming to our group of 20.
testimonials.author: Bill O.

testimonials.quote: Our annual group plays ArrowCreek Country Club every year through GTHS. The course never disappoints — it's always in tournament condition. The Reno, NV scenery makes it feel like a bucket-list round every time.
testimonials.author: Jason E.

testimonials.quote: We drove up from the Bay Area specifically to play ArrowCreek Country Club. Absolutely worth it. The Reno, NV mountain backdrop on every hole is something special. GTHS arranged preferred tee times that worked perfectly for our group.
testimonials.author: Rebecca N.
